info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 11:34PM EST until February 05 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Transylvania and Henderson Counties. .Approximately 3-5 inches of rain have fallen across the upper French Broad watershed over the past 24 hours, causing significant rises along the French Broad River and associated tributaries. The heaviest rainfall has departed the area but additional rounds of light to moderate rainfall are expected through Friday morning. Therefore, it will take many hours for excessive runoff to subside and for tributaries to crest and begin their recession. These high flows are causing the upper French Broad River to exceed bankfull, resulting in scattered nuisance flooding from Rosman to Brevard, Etowah, Blantyre, and Horse Shoe. It is increasingly likely that the French Broad River near Blantyre will exceed the Minor Flood Stage of 16.0 feet during the day on Friday, causing widespread flooding of adjacent low-lying farmland and isolated flooding of adjacent roadways. If confidence increases overnight that the river will exceed 16.5 feet, this Flood Advisory will be upgraded to a Flood Warning. Please stay weather aware tonight and monitor the latest forecasts and stream levels for up-to-date information. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. Minor flooding is possible later tonight through Friday. * WHERE...French Broad River At Blantyre. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Farmland flooding continues on both sides of the French Broad River. Floodwaters begin to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Rd. and Crab Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EST Thursday the stage was 13.5 feet and rising steadily. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above Minor Flood Stage late tomorrow morning to a crest between 16.5 and 17.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below Minor Flood Stage late Saturday morning. - Action/Advisory Stage is 15.0 feet. - Minor Flood Stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
